Population

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12211 Microcensus

Definition:
The representation of microcensus results at the individual
level - without reference to the household or living
arrangement context - is based on the "population at the
sole or main residence". According to this definition,
"population" comprises all persons with just one dwelling,
and persons with several dwellings, at their main residence.
This is the dwelling a person usually lives in. For reasons
of registration regulations, soldiers performing compulsory
military service or reserve duty training are allocated to
the municipality they lived in before they were drafted.
This approach is also followed for patients in hospitals and
people in detention awaiting trial. Professional and
temporary soldiers, members of the Federal Border Police and
of the Alert Police in collective living quarters, convicted
prisoners, as well as permanent inmates of collective living
quarters and the staff living there are covered both in the
municipalities in which such living quarters are located and
in the municipalities in which such persons may have another
residence. Members of the foreign armed forces stationed in
the Federal Republic of Germany and of foreign diplomatic
missions and consular posts and their family members are
generally not covered by statistics.
